summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney providing an update on a FOIA case related to Jeffrey Epstein. It summarizes a challenging oral argument before Judge Engelmayer, who expressed skepticism about the breadth of the government's document withholdings under FOIA Exemption 7(A) and will order an in camera review. The court also inquired about document production in the related 'Noel' case and suggested reconsideration of the FOIA response.

persons.name: Judge Engelmayer
persons.context: Presided over the oral argument in the Epstein FOIA case, expressed skepticism about the government's document withholdings, and will order an in camera review.

persons.name: Audrey
persons.role: Presumably a Department of Justice official
persons.context: The court directed the email's author to communicate with Audrey, asking her to reconsider the FOIA response and potentially confer with Main Justice, especially in light of the recent change in administration.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.role: Defendant in a related criminal case
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of FOIA Exemption 7(A) withholdings; the court will direct that material withheld specifically in connection with the Tartaglione case be marked out.

persons.name: Noel
persons.role: Defendant in a related criminal case
persons.context: Mentioned regarding the broader set of material withheld on the theory of interfering with the 'Noel' criminal case. The court inquired about how much withheld material had been produced to the Noel defendants under Rule 16.

connections.description: Judge Engelmayer directed the AUSA to communicate with Audrey, asking her to reconsider the FOIA response in the case.

events.title: Oral Argument in Epstein FOIA Case
events.description: A challenging, approximately two-hour oral argument was held before Judge Engelmayer regarding the government's withholdings in the Epstein FOIA case.

events.title: Court Order for In Camera Review
events.description: Judge Engelmayer will enter an order directing that documents withheld under FOIA Exemption 7(A) be produced to the court for in camera review.

keyFacts: Judge Engelmayer is highly skeptical of the government's broad use of FOIA Exemption 7(A) to withhold documents related to Jeffrey Epstein and will conduct an in camera review.
The court distinguished between material withheld specifically for the Tartaglione case and material withheld for the broader 'Noel' case, requesting they be marked separately.
The court inquired about how much of the withheld FOIA material had already been produced to defendants in the related 'Noel' criminal case under Rule 16 discovery rules.
The court suggested the recent change in U.S. administration could be grounds for the Department of Justice to reconsider its FOIA response and potentially release more documents.
